Title: Cylinder Seal with Seated Deity and Figures
Description: The scene depicts an interceding deity with one hand raised; with the other hand, the interceding deity leads a worshipper before a seated, bearded god wearing a tufted robe. There is a cuneiform inscription in two registers.
Provenance: Sadie Jones (Mrs. Henry Walters), New York [date and mode of acquisition unknown]; Sale, Joseph Brummer, New York, 1941; Walters Art Museum, 1941, by purchase.
Creator: Near Eastern
